The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit. Here you also define if items in inventory or on incoming orders are automatically reserved for outbound documents and whether order tracking links are created between demand and supply to reflect planning actions.

trans-unit.source: Get insight into the financial data stored in your chart of accounts. Account schedules analyze figures in G/L accounts, and compare general ledger entries with general ledger budget entries. For example, you can view the general ledger entries as percentages of the budget entries. Account schedules provide the data for core financial statements and views, such as the Cash Flow chart.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Account Schedules - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Account Schedules - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or organize the general ledger accounts that store your financial data. All values from business transactions or internal adjustments end up in designated G/L accounts. Business Central includes a standard chart of accounts that is ready to support businesses in your country, but you can change the default accounts and add new ones.

Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action3 - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action62 - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Dimensions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or modify employees' details and related information, such as qualifications and pictures, or register and analyze employee absence. Keeping up-to-date records about your employees simplifies personnel tasks. For example, if an employee's address changes, you register this on the employee card.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Employees - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Employees - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Personalize the structure of your financial statements by mapping general ledger accounts to account categories. You can create category groups by indenting subcategories under them. Each grouping shows a total balance. When you choose the Generate Account Schedules action, the account schedules for the underlying financial reports are updated. The next time you run one of these reports, such as the balance statement, new totals and subentries are added, based on your changes.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action G/L Account Categories - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action G/L Account Categories - Property Caption

trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action G/L Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action G/L Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post financial transactions directly to general ledger accounts and other accounts, such as bank, customer, vendor, and employee accounts. Posting with a general journal always creates entries on general ledger accounts. This is true even when, for example, you post a journal line to a customer account, because an entry is posted to a general ledger receivables account through a posting group.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action GeneralJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action GeneralJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your inventory according to key performance indicators that you select, for example inventory turnover. You can also use the report to analyze your inventory costs, in terms of direct and indirect costs, as well as the value and quantities of your different types of inventory.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Inventory Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Inventory Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted general journal lines.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action PostedGeneralJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action PostedGeneralJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your purchase volumes. You can also use the report to analyze your vendors' performance and purchase prices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enter item purchases values of type amount, quantity, or cost for expected item purchases in different time periods. You can create purchase budgets by items, vendors, vendor groups, or other dimensions in your business. The resulting purchase budgets can be reviewed here or they can be used in comparisons with actual purchases data in purchase analysis reports.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your sales according to key sales performance indicators that you select, for example, sales turnover in both amounts and quantities, contribution margin, or progress of actual sales against the budget. You can also use the report to analyze your average sales prices and evaluate the sales performance of your sales force.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enter item sales values of type amount, quantity, or cost for expected item sales in different time periods. You can create sales budgets by items, customers, customer groups, or other dimensions in your business. The resulting sales budgets can be reviewed here or they can be used in comparisons with actual sales data in sales analysis reports.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Prepare the VAT Return report so you can submit VAT amounts to a tax authority.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action VAT Returns - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action VAT Returns - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a statement of posted VAT amounts, calculate your VAT settlement amount for a certain period, such as a quarter, and prepare to send the settlement to the tax authorities.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action VAT Statements - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action VAT Statements - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make quotes, orders, and credit memos to customers. Manage customers and view transaction history.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action40 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action40 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the products that you trade in. The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action129 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action129 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket sales orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your customers to sell large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a sales order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes..
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Send finance charge memos to customers with delayed payments, typically following a reminder process. Finance charges are calculated automatically and added to the overdue amounts on the customer's account according to the specified finance charge terms and penalty/interest amounts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the list of issued finance charge memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the list of issued reminders.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Issued Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Issued Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit the codes for item charges that you can assign to purchase and sales transactions to include any added costs, such as freight, physical handling, and insurance that you incur when purchasing or selling items. This is important to ensure correct inventory valuation. For purchases, the landed cost of a purchased item consists of the vendor's purchase price and all additional direct item charges that can be assigned to individual receipts or return shipments. For sales, knowing the cost of shipping sold items can be as vital to your company as knowing the landed cost of purchased items.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Item Charges - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Item Charges - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales return receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Remind customers about overdue amounts based on reminder terms and the related reminder levels. Each reminder level includes rules about when the reminder will be issued in relation to the invoice due date or the date of the previous reminder and whether interests are added. Reminders are integrated with finance charge memos, which are documents informing customers of interests or other money penalties for payment delays.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Revert the financial transactions involved when your customers want to cancel a purchase or return incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. To include the correct information, you can create the sales credit memo from the related posted sales invoice or you can create a new sales credit memo with copied invoice information. If you need more control of the sales return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use sales return orders, in which sales credit memos are integrated. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register your sales to customers and invite them to pay according to the delivery and payment terms by sending them a sales invoice document. Posting a sales invoice registers shipment and records an open receivable entry on the customer's account, which will be closed when payment is received. To manage the shipment process, use sales orders, in which sales invoicing is integrated.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record your agreements with customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. Sales orders, unlike sales invoices, allow you to ship partially, deliver directly from your vendor to your customer, initiate warehouse handling, and print various customer-facing documents. Sales invoicing is integrated in the sales order process.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make offers to customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. While you negotiate with a customer, you can change and resend the sales quote as much as needed. When the customer accepts the offer, you convert the sales quote to a sales invoice or a sales order in which you process the sale.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Compensate your customers for incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. Sales return orders support warehouse documents for the item handling, the ability to return items from multiple sales documents with one return, and automatic creation of related sales credit memos or other return-related documents, such as a replacement sales order.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the customers that you trade with. From each customer card, you can open related information, such as sales statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that you grant if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales_CustomerList - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Sales_CustomerList - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage purchase invoices and credit memos. Maintain vendors and their history.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action41 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action41 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Credit Memos> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Credit Memos> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Invoices> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Invoices> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Receipts> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Receipts> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase credit memos to mirror sales credit memos that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. If you need more control of the purchase return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use purchase return orders, in which purchase credit memos are integrated. Purchase credit memos can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Credit Memos> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Credit Memos> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase invoices to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase invoices dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase invoices can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Invoices> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Invoices> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase orders to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase orders dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase orders allow partial receipts, unlike with purchase invoices, and enable drop shipment directly from your vendor to your customer. Purchase orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Orders> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Orders> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit the codes for item charges that you can assign to purchase and sales transactions to include any added costs, such as freight, physical handling, and insurance that you incur when purchasing or selling items. This is important to ensure correct inventory valuation. For purchases, the landed cost of a purchased item consists of the vendor's purchase price and all additional direct item charges that can be assigned to individual receipts or return shipments. For sales, knowing the cost of shipping sold items can be as vital to your company as knowing the landed cost of purchased items.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action131 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action131 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket purchase orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your vendors to buy large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a purchase order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Handle incoming documents, such as vendor invoices in PDF or as image files, that you can manually or automatically convert to document records, such as purchase invoices. The external files that represent incoming documents can be attached at any process stage, including to posted documents and to the resulting vendor, customer, and general ledger entries.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Incoming Documents - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Incoming Documents - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase return shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase quotes to represent your request for quotes from vendors. Quotes can be converted to purchase orders.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase return orders to mirror sales return documents that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. Purchase return orders enable you to ship back items from multiple purchase documents with one purchase return and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Purchase return orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the vendors that you trade with. From each vendor card, you can open related information, such as purchase statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that the vendor grants you if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase_VendorList - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Purchase_VendorList - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Process incoming and outgoing payments. Set up bank accounts and service connections for electronic banking.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Management - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Management - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or set up detailed information about your bank account, such as which currency to use, the format of bank files that you import and export as electronic payments, and the numbering of checks.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action23 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action23 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View statements for selected bank accounts. For each bank transaction, the report shows a description, an applied amount, a statement amount, and other information.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Bank Acc. Statements - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Bank Acc. Statements - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Reconcile bank accounts in your system with bank statements received from your bank.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action BankAccountReconciliations - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action BankAccountReconciliations - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Combine various financial data sources to find out when a cash surplus or deficit might happen or whether you should pay down debt, or borrow to meet upcoming expenses.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Forecasts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Forecasts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record manual expenses, such as salaries, interest on credit, or planned investments to be used in cash flow forecasting.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Manual Expenses - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Manual Expenses - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record manual revenues, such as rental income, interest from financial assets, or new private capital to be used in cash flow forecasting.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Manual Revenues - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Cash Flow Manual Revenues - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register received payments by manually applying them to the related customer, vendor, or bank ledger entries. Then, post the payments to G/L accounts and thereby close the related ledger entries.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action CashReceiptJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action CashReceiptJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a chart contain a graphical representation of one or more cash flow accounts and one or more cash flow setups for the included general ledger, purchase, sales, services, or fixed assets accounts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Chart of Cash Flow Accounts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Chart of Cash Flow Accounts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage bank deposits to your bank accounts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Deposits - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Deposits - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Instruct your bank to withdraw payment amounts from your customer's bank account and transfer them to your company's account. A direct debit collection holds information about the customer's bank account, the affected sales invoices, and the customer's agreement, the so-called direct-debit mandate. From the resulting direct-debit collection entry, you can then export an XML file that you send or upload to your bank for processing.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Direct Debit Collections - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Direct Debit Collections - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Reconcile unpaid documents automatically with their related bank transactions by importing a bank statement feed or file. In the payment reconciliation journal, incoming or outgoing payments on your bank are automatically, or semi-automatically, applied to their related open customer or vendor ledger entries. Any open bank account ledger entries related to the applied customer or vendor ledger entries will be closed when you choose the Post Payments and Reconcile Bank Account action. This means that the bank account is automatically reconciled for payments that you post with the journal.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Payment Recon. Journals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Payment Recon. Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up the payment terms that you select from on customer cards to define when the customer must pay, such as within 14 days.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Payment Terms - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Payment Terms - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register payments to vendors. A payment journal is a type of general journal that is used to post outgoing payment transactions to G/L, bank, customer, vendor, employee, and fixed assets accounts. The Suggest Vendor Payments functions automatically fills the journal with payments that are due. When payments are posted, you can export the payments to a bank file for upload to your bank if your system is set up for electronic banking. You can also issue computer checks from the payment journal.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action PaymentJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action PaymentJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Overview and change system and application settings, and manage extensions and services
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action SetupAndExtensions - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action SetupAndExtensions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up core functionality such as sales tax, sending documents as email, and approval workflow by running through a few pages that guide you through the information.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action104 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action104 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Install Extensions for greater functionality of the system.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action106 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action106 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enable and configure external services, such as exchange rate updates, Microsoft Social Engagement, and electronic bank integration.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action107 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Action107 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Define your company policies for business departments and for general activities by filling setup windows manually.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Manual Setup - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Manual Setup - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up or enable workflows that connect business-process tasks performed by different users. System tasks, such as automatic posting, can be included as steps in workflows, preceded or followed by user tasks. Requesting and granting approval to create new records are typical workflow steps.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Workflows - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_FinanceMgrRoleCenter - Action Workflows - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_FreightZones - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRCActivities - Control To Send or Confirm - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRCActivities - Control NotInvoiced - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRCActivities - Control PartiallyInvoiced - Property Caption

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRCActivities - Action RefreshData - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage your business. See KPIs, trial balance, and favorite customers.

trans-unit.source: View or set up detailed information about your bank account, such as which currency to use, the format of bank files that you import and export as electronic payments, and the numbering of checks.

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Bank Accounts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or organize the general ledger accounts that store your financial data. All values from business transactions or internal adjustments end up in designated G/L accounts. Business Central includes a standard chart of accounts that is ready to support businesses in your country, but you can change the default accounts and add new ones.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Chart of Accounts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Chart of Accounts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the customers that you trade with. From each customer card, you can open related information, such as sales statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that you grant if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Customers - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Customers - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the products that you trade in. The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit. Here you also define if items in inventory or on incoming orders are automatically reserved for outbound documents and whether order tracking links are created between demand and supply to reflect planning actions.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Items - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Items - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the vendors that you trade with. From each vendor card, you can open related information, such as purchase statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that the vendor grants you if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendors - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendors - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Find entries and documents that exist for the document number and posting date on the selected document. (Formerly this action was named Navigate.)
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Navigate - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Navigate - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action New - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Customer - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Customer - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Payments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Opens vendor ledger entries for all vendors with invoices that have not been paid yet.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Create Vendor Payments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Create Vendor Payments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: To start the process of reconciling new payments, import a bank feed or electronic file containing the related bank transactions.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Import Bank Transactions - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Import Bank Transactions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Reconcile your bank account by importing transactions and applying them, automatically or manually, to open customer ledger entries, open vendor ledger entries, or open bank account ledger entries.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Payment Reconciliation Journals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Payment Reconciliation Journals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Process your customer payments by matching amounts received on your bank account with the related unpaid sales invoices, and then post the payments.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Register Customer Payments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Register Customer Payments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or set up price lists for products that you buy from the vendor. A product price is automatically granted on invoice lines when the specified criteria are met, such as vendor, quantity, or ending date.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Price Lists - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Price Lists - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Reports - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Financial Statements - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View your company's assets, liabilities, and equity.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Balance Sheet - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Balance Sheet - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View your company's income and expenses.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Income Statement - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Income Statement - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a report that shows the sales taxes that have been collected on behalf of the authorities.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Taxes Collected - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Taxes Collected - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a financial statement that shows how changes in balance sheet accounts and income affect the company's cash holdings, displayed for operating, investing, and financing activities respectively.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Statement of Cash Flows - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Statement of Cash Flows - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a report that shows your company's changes in retained earnings for a specified period by reconciling the beginning and ending retained earnings for the period, using information such as net income from the other financial statements.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Statement of Retained Earnings - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Statement of Retained Earnings - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Setup - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Set up core functionality such as sales tax, sending documents as email, and approval workflow by running through a few pages that guide you through the information.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Assisted Setup - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Assisted Setup - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enter the company name, address, and bank information that will be inserted on your business documents.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Company Settings - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Company Settings - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Services & Extensions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Install Extensions for greater functionality of the system.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Extensions - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Extensions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enable and configure external services, such as exchange rate updates, Microsoft Social Engagement, and electronic bank integration.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Service Connections - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Service Connections - Property Caption
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Excel Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows a list of aged remaining balances for each vendor by period.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateAgedAccPay - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateAgedAccPay - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows when customer payments are due or overdue by period.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateAgedAccRec - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateAgedAccRec - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows how changes in balance sheet accounts and income affect the company's cash holdings.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateCashFlowStmt - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateCashFlowStmt - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows your company's income and expenses.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateIncomeStmt - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateIncomeStmt - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows your company's changes in retained earnings based on net income from the other financial statements.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateRetainedEarn - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateRetainedEarn - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows your company's assets, liabilities, and equity.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplatesBalanceSheet - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplatesBalanceSheet - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open a spreadsheet that shows a summary trial balance by account.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateTrialBalance - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action ExcelTemplateTrialBalance - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View price information for your items or stockkeeping units, such as direct unit cost, last direct cost, unit price, profit percentage, and profit.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory &Cost and Price List - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory &Cost and Price List - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of items on order from vendors. The report also shows the expected receipt date and the quantity and amount on back orders. The report can be used, for example, to see when items should be received and whether a reminder of a back order should be issued.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory &Purchase Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory &Purchase Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of the quantity of each item in customer, purchase, and transfer orders and the quantity available in inventory. The list is divided into columns that cover six periods with starting and ending dates as well as the periods before and after those periods. The list is useful when you are planning your inventory purchases.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory - &Availability Plan - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory - &Availability Plan - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of the vendors that your company has purchased items from within a selected period. It shows invoiced quantity, amount and discount. The report can be used to analyze a company's item purchases.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory - &Vendor Purchases - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory - &Vendor Purchases - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the list of purchase receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of the vendors from whom you purchase the most or to whom you owe the most.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor - T&op 10 List - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor - T&op 10 List - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a list of item entries for each vendor in a selected period.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor/&Item Purchases - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Vendor/&Item Purchases - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post financial transactions, manage budgets, analyze G/L data, and prepare financial statements.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action39 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action39 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Get insight into the financial data stored in your chart of accounts. Account schedules analyze figures in G/L accounts, and compare general ledger entries with general ledger budget entries. For example, you can view the general ledger entries as percentages of the budget entries. Account schedules provide the data for core financial statements and views, such as the Cash Flow chart.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Account Schedules - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Account Schedules - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or organize the general ledger accounts that store your financial data. All values from business transactions or internal adjustments end up in designated G/L accounts. Business Central includes a standard chart of accounts that is ready to support businesses in your country, but you can change the default accounts and add new ones.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action3 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action3 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage periodic depreciation of your machinery or machines, keep track of your maintenance costs, manage insurance policies related to fixed assets, and monitor fixed asset statistics.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action62 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action62 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the different currencies that you trade in or update the exchange rates by getting the latest rates from an external service provider.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Currencies - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Currencies - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit dimensions, such as area, project, or department, that you can assign to sales and purchase documents to distribute costs and analyze transaction history.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Dimensions - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Dimensions - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or modify employees' details and related information, such as qualifications and pictures, or register and analyze employee absence. Keeping up-to-date records about your employees simplifies personnel tasks. For example, if an employee's address changes, you register this on the employee card.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Employees - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Employees - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Personalize the structure of your financial statements by mapping general ledger accounts to account categories. You can create category groups by indenting subcategories under them. Each grouping shows a total balance. When you choose the Generate Account Schedules action, the account schedules for the underlying financial reports are updated. The next time you run one of these reports, such as the balance statement, new totals and subentries are added, based on your changes.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action G/L Account Categories - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action G/L Account Categories - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View summary information about the amount budgeted for each general ledger account in different time periods.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action G/L Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action G/L Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Post financial transactions directly to general ledger accounts and other accounts, such as bank, customer, vendor, and employee accounts. Posting with a general journal always creates entries on general ledger accounts. This is true even when, for example, you post a journal line to a customer account, because an entry is posted to a general ledger receivables account through a posting group.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action GeneralJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action GeneralJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your inventory according to key performance indicators that you select, for example inventory turnover. You can also use the report to analyze your inventory costs, in terms of direct and indirect costs, as well as the value and quantities of your different types of inventory.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Inventory Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted general journal lines.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action PostedGeneralJournals - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action PostedGeneralJournals - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your purchase volumes. You can also use the report to analyze your vendors' performance and purchase prices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enter item purchases values of type amount, quantity, or cost for expected item purchases in different time periods. You can create purchase budgets by items, vendors, vendor groups, or other dimensions in your business. The resulting purchase budgets can be reviewed here or they can be used in comparisons with actual purchases data in purchase analysis reports.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Analyze the dynamics of your sales according to key sales performance indicators that you select, for example, sales turnover in both amounts and quantities, contribution margin, or progress of actual sales against the budget. You can also use the report to analyze your average sales prices and evaluate the sales performance of your sales force.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Analysis Reports - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Analysis Reports - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Enter item sales values of type amount, quantity, or cost for expected item sales in different time periods. You can create sales budgets by items, customers, customer groups, or other dimensions in your business. The resulting sales budgets can be reviewed here or they can be used in comparisons with actual sales data in sales analysis reports.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Budgets - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Budgets - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Prepare the VAT Return report so you can submit VAT amounts to a tax authority.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action VAT Returns - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action VAT Returns - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View a statement of posted VAT amounts, calculate your VAT settlement amount for a certain period, such as a quarter, and prepare to send the settlement to the tax authorities.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action VAT Statements - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action VAT Statements - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make quotes, orders, and credit memos to customers. Manage customers and view transaction history.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action40 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action40 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the products that you trade in. The item card can be of type Inventory or Service to specify if the item is a physical unit or a labor time unit.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action129 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action129 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket sales orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your customers to sell large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a sales order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes..
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Send finance charge memos to customers with delayed payments, typically following a reminder process. Finance charges are calculated automatically and added to the overdue amounts on the customer's account according to the specified finance charge terms and penalty/interest amounts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the list of issued finance charge memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Issued Finance Charge Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View the list of issued reminders.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Issued Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Issued Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit the codes for item charges that you can assign to purchase and sales transactions to include any added costs, such as freight, physical handling, and insurance that you incur when purchasing or selling items. This is important to ensure correct inventory valuation. For purchases, the landed cost of a purchased item consists of the vendor's purchase price and all additional direct item charges that can be assigned to individual receipts or return shipments. For sales, knowing the cost of shipping sold items can be as vital to your company as knowing the landed cost of purchased items.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Item Charges - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Item Charges - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales return receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Return Receipts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted sales shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Sales Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Remind customers about overdue amounts based on reminder terms and the related reminder levels. Each reminder level includes rules about when the reminder will be issued in relation to the invoice due date or the date of the previous reminder and whether interests are added. Reminders are integrated with finance charge memos, which are documents informing customers of interests or other money penalties for payment delays.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Reminders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Reminders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Revert the financial transactions involved when your customers want to cancel a purchase or return incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. To include the correct information, you can create the sales credit memo from the related posted sales invoice or you can create a new sales credit memo with copied invoice information. If you need more control of the sales return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use sales return orders, in which sales credit memos are integrated. Note: If an erroneous sale has not been paid yet, you can simply cancel the posted sales invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Credit Memos - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Register your sales to customers and invite them to pay according to the delivery and payment terms by sending them a sales invoice document. Posting a sales invoice registers shipment and records an open receivable entry on the customer's account, which will be closed when payment is received. To manage the shipment process, use sales orders, in which sales invoicing is integrated.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Invoices - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Invoices - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Record your agreements with customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. Sales orders, unlike sales invoices, allow you to ship partially, deliver directly from your vendor to your customer, initiate warehouse handling, and print various customer-facing documents. Sales invoicing is integrated in the sales order process.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Make offers to customers to sell certain products on certain delivery and payment terms. While you negotiate with a customer, you can change and resend the sales quote as much as needed. When the customer accepts the offer, you convert the sales quote to a sales invoice or a sales order in which you process the sale.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Compensate your customers for incorrect or damaged items that you sent to them and received payment for. Sales return orders support warehouse documents for the item handling, the ability to return items from multiple sales documents with one return, and automatic creation of related sales credit memos or other return-related documents, such as a replacement sales order.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the customers that you trade with. From each customer card, you can open related information, such as sales statistics and ongoing orders, and you can define special prices and line discounts that you grant if certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales_CustomerList - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Sales_CustomerList - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Manage purchase invoices and credit memos. Maintain vendors and their history.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action41 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action41 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase credit memos.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Credit Memos> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Credit Memos> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase invoices.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Invoices> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Invoices> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase receipts.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Receipts> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Posted Purchase Receipts> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase credit memos to mirror sales credit memos that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. If you need more control of the purchase return process, such as warehouse documents for the physical handling, use purchase return orders, in which purchase credit memos are integrated. Purchase credit memos can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Credit Memos> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Credit Memos> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase invoices to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase invoices dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase invoices can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Invoices> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Invoices> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase orders to mirror sales documents that vendors send to you. This enables you to record the cost of purchases and to track accounts payable. Posting purchase orders dynamically updates inventory levels so that you can minimize inventory costs and provide better customer service. Purchase orders allow partial receipts, unlike with purchase invoices, and enable drop shipment directly from your vendor to your customer. Purchase orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Orders> - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action <Page Purchase Orders> - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit the codes for item charges that you can assign to purchase and sales transactions to include any added costs, such as freight, physical handling, and insurance that you incur when purchasing or selling items. This is important to ensure correct inventory valuation. For purchases, the landed cost of a purchased item consists of the vendor's purchase price and all additional direct item charges that can be assigned to individual receipts or return shipments. For sales, knowing the cost of shipping sold items can be as vital to your company as knowing the landed cost of purchased items.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action131 - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Action131 - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Use blanket purchase orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your vendors to buy large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a purchase order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Blanket Purchase Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Handle incoming documents, such as vendor invoices in PDF or as image files, that you can manually or automatically convert to document records, such as purchase invoices. The external files that represent incoming documents can be attached at any process stage, including to posted documents and to the resulting vendor, customer, and general ledger entries.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Incoming Documents - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Incoming Documents - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Open the list of posted purchase return shipments.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Posted Purchase Return Shipments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase quotes to represent your request for quotes from vendors. Quotes can be converted to purchase orders.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Quotes - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Quotes - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Create purchase return orders to mirror sales return documents that vendors send to you for incorrect or damaged items that you have paid for and then returned to the vendor. Purchase return orders enable you to ship back items from multiple purchase documents with one purchase return and support warehouse documents for the item handling. Purchase return orders can be created automatically from PDF or image files from your vendors by using the Incoming Documents feature. Note: If you have not yet paid for an erroneous purchase, you can simply cancel the posted purchase invoice to automatically revert the financial transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property ToolTip
Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Purchase Return Orders - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: View or edit detailed information for the vendors that you trade with. trans-unit.source: Instruct your bank to withdraw payment amounts from your customer's bank account and transfer them to your company's account. A direct debit collection holds information about the customer's bank account, the affected sales invoices, and the customer's agreement, the so-called direct-debit mandate. From the resulting direct-debit collection entry, you can then export an XML file that you send or upload to your bank for processing.

Page FS_RF_PurchasingRoleCenter - Action Direct Debit Collections - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Reconcile unpaid documents automatically with their related bank transactions by importing a bank statement feed or file. In the payment reconciliation journal, incoming or outgoing payments on your bank are automatically, or semi-automatically, applied to their related open customer or vendor ledger entries. Any open bank account ledger entries related to the applied customer or vendor ledger entries will be closed when you choose the Post Payments and Reconcile Bank Account action. This means that the bank account is automatically reconciled for payments that you post with the journal.

trans-unit.source: Register payments to vendors. A payment journal is a type of general journal that is used to post outgoing payment transactions to G/L, bank, customer, vendor, employee, and fixed assets accounts. The Suggest Vendor Payments functions automatically fills the journal with payments that are due. When payments are posted, you can export the payments to a bank file for upload to your bank if your system is set up for electronic banking. You can also issue computer checks from the payment journal.

Account schedules analyze figures in G/L accounts, and compare general ledger entries with general ledger budget entries. For example, you can view the general ledger entries as percentages of the budget entries. Account schedules provide the data for core financial statements and views, such as the Cash Flow chart.

When you choose the Generate Account Schedules action, the account schedules for the underlying financial reports are updated. The next time you run one of these reports, such as the balance statement, new totals and subentries are added, based on your changes.

Posting with a general journal always creates entries on general ledger accounts. This is true even when, for example, you post a journal line to a customer account, because an entry is posted to a general ledger receivables account through a posting group.

trans-unit.source: Use blanket sales orders as a framework for a long-term agreement between you and your customers to sell large quantities that are to be delivered in several smaller shipments over a certain period of time. Blanket orders often cover only one item with predetermined delivery dates. The main reason for using a blanket order rather than a sales order is that quantities entered on a blanket order do not affect item availability and thus can be used as a worksheet for monitoring, forecasting, and planning purposes..

Page FS_RF_ServiceMgrRoleCenter - Action Blanket Sales Orders - Property Caption

Finance charges are calculated automatically and added to the overdue amounts on the customer's account according to the specified finance charge terms and penalty/interest amounts.
